thread.title: 12-Year-Old Boys Called Heroes After Rescuing 4-Year-Old With Autism from Pond
thread.title_full: 12-Year-Old Boys Called Heroes After Rescuing 4-Year-Old With Autism from Pond

author: Maya Chung
title: 12-Year-Old Boys Called Heroes After Rescuing 4-Year-Old With Autism from Pond
text:
12-Year-Old Boys Called Heroes After Rescuing 4-Year-Old With Autism from Pond Inside Edition 5 hrs ago Maya Chung © Provided by CBS Interactive Inc. The 4-year-old was later reunited with her family. Two 12-year-old boys are being called heroes by authorities after they rescued a 4-year-old girl with autism from drowning in a Texas pond on Thursday.
According to reports, the boys, Markuise and Cameron, were riding their bikes when a 4-year-old, Melody, tried to swing on a limb and fell into the water.
They boys then reportedly pulled the girl out of the water and ran to get help. Police were then called to the scene.
“The two 12 year-old boys who saved this girl are heroes in the eyes of RFPD. Thank you for your quick action,” Roman Forest Police wrote on their Facebook page .
Melody was reunited with her family at the hospital later that evening, police said.
“4 year old girl is okay. No charges will be filed at this time pending a complete investigation," they wrote. "Mother and child have been reunited.”
